citations.narrative:
There is not an identifiable, readily available attendant during all areas and times of public contact with animals. There are
multiple public contact areas including 2 goat feeding areas - one containing approximately 35 adult goats and one
containing 7 adult goats and 5 adult sheep - where members of the public are allowed to let themselves into the animal
pen. There are also pens where direct contact with the public takes place through a fence, including a pen containing 2
adult cows, a pen containing 3 adult alpaca and 1 adult llama, and a pen containing 3 adult pigs. At the time of inspection,
only one dedicated attendant was present to monitor all five pens that allow public contact. It is not possible for a single
attendant to be present and directly monitor all areas of public contact at once.
Without an attendant, animals are at greater risk of experiencing physical injury and behavioral stress, and members of
the public may be at greater risk of injury. Correct by ensuring that a responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable
attendant is present at all times during periods of public contact.

The facility has not developed a complete written plan to provide humane care for handling animals in the event of an
emergency or disaster.
A written plan shall be developed and maintained to provide guidance for the appropriate care of the animals during
emergencies that could reasonably be anticipated. The plan shall address specific tasks required to be carried out in
response to the identified emergencies, personnel responsible for the actions to be taken, chain of command, etc., as
required in Section 2.134 of the animal welfare regulations.
Correct by developing and documenting a contingency plan by May1, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
